parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (CMF11240003) at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used by candidates in Romania for campaign materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions "Pop Sebastian Tiberiu" as a candidate for the Chamber of Deputies for the PNCR (Partidul Național Conservator Român). This clearly identifies a parliamentary candidate and fulfills Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, this content is designed to reach a wide audience, not just a select few.  The use of hashtags further amplifies its reach and public nature, satisfying Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post promotes Sebastian Tiberiu Pop's legislative initiative focused on civic education. While seemingly beneficial, the overall objective is to enhance his image and implicitly encourage voters to support him in the parliamentary elections.  The hashtags "#ViitorulEAlTău", "#TineriiVotează", "#PutereaVotului", and "#PNCR" directly relate to the election and aim to influence voters' choices. This satisfies Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Although the post presents information about civic education in other European countries, it's primarily framed within the context of Pop's candidacy and his political platform. The presentation is not objective journalistic reporting but rather advocacy for his political agenda.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a structured presentation of a political proposal by a candidate seeking election. The personal opinions are subordinated to the electoral objective.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>544331185048380</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda under Romanian law. The presence of a CMF number, explicit mention of a candidate, targeting a wide audience through a paid Facebook post, and the clear intention to influence voters' choices in the parliamentary elections all point towards a violation.  The post uses positive framing of the candidate's initiative to indirectly promote his candidacy.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>Pop Sebastian Tiberiu</name>
    <impact>POSITIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNCR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Entitatea responsabilă pentru postarea plătită, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 544331185048380) cu conținut electoral, care promovează candidatul Pop Sebastian Tiberiu pentru Camera Deputaților din partea PNCR, folosind un număr CMF (CMF11240003),  având ca efect electoral influențarea pozitivă a voturilor în favoarea acestuia. Postarea, deși prezintă informații despre educația civică, este structurată în mod evident pentru a-i promova imaginea și platforma politică,  folosind hashtag-uri precum "#ViitorulEAlTău", "#TineriiVotează", "#PutereaVotului" și "#PNCR", care au scopul clar de a influența votul.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
